comment.author: 71423829@N00
comment._content: If only this spacious elegance was still there!  Also noticeable in these old photographs is the lack of street furniture and signage that blights modern photography of street scenes in our towns and cities.

comment.author: 30884978@N00
comment._content: There is a definite sense of newness and pride, even with a little horse-poo evident to the right. ;)

comment.author: 8425825@N08
comment._content: Simply amazing!  I'd love so much to go for a walk up 1858 princes street with no crowds, shops, buses or people with clip boards looking money.  It makes me sad that all this character has been paved over and commercialised, the only way the city would survive though.  I'd rather dodge the odd pile of horse poo than pushy charity workers ;-)

comment.author: 81813159@N00
comment._content: How I wish Princes Street was still like this rather than the mish mash of mediocre architecture!

comment.author: 8425825@N08
comment._content: This photograph has been discussed in the Flickr Commons group in Edinburgh: Then & Now

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: Hi, this photo was used in a Then and Now project about Edinburgh in the Flickr Commons group, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 28018479@N00
comment._content: Forget the trams, bring back the horse poo!
